
 
# How to Download and Install Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software for Your PLC
 
If you are looking for a reliable and easy-to-use software for programming and monitoring your PLC, you might want to consider Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software. This software is compatible with various models of PLCs from Omron, Mitsubishi, Siemens, and others. It allows you to create ladder diagrams, function blocks, structured text, and other languages for your PLC logic. It also enables you to simulate, debug, and test your programs before downloading them to your PLC.
 
**Download Zip ::: [https://vercupalo.blogspot.com/?d=2uzQht](https://vercupalo.blogspot.com/?d=2uzQht)**


 
In this article, we will show you how to download and install Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software for your PLC. You will need a PC with Windows operating system and a USB cable to connect your PC and PLC. Follow these steps to get started:
 
1. Go to the official website of Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software at [https://www.nt20sst121bev3.com/](https://www.nt20sst121bev3.com/) and click on the "Download" button.
2. You will be redirected to a page where you can choose the language and version of the software. Select the appropriate options and click on "Download Now".
3. You will see a pop-up window asking you to save the file. Choose a location on your PC where you want to save the file and click on "Save".
4. Once the download is complete, locate the file on your PC and double-click on it to start the installation process.
5. You will see a welcome screen with some information about the software. Click on "Next" to continue.
6. You will see a license agreement screen. Read the terms and conditions carefully and check the box that says "I accept the terms in the license agreement". Click on "Next" to continue.
7. You will see a destination folder screen where you can choose where to install the software on your PC. You can use the default location or browse for another one. Click on "Next" to continue.
8. You will see a ready to install screen where you can review your choices. Click on "Install" to start the installation.
9. The installation will take some time depending on your PC speed and internet connection. You will see a progress bar showing the status of the installation.
10. When the installation is complete, you will see a completion screen. Click on "Finish" to exit the installer.

Congratulations! You have successfully downloaded and installed Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software for your PLC. You can now launch the software from your desktop or start menu and start programming your PLC.
  
## How to Use Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software for Your PLC
 
Now that you have installed Nt20s St121b Ev3 Software for your PLC, you might be wondering how to use it. In this section, we will give you a brief overview of the main features and functions of the software. You can also refer to the user manual or the online help for more details and instructions.
 
The software has a user-friendly interface that consists of several windows and toolbars. You can customize the layout and appearance of the interface according to your preferences. The main windows are:

- The Project Explorer window, where you can create, open, save, and manage your projects. A project is a collection of files and settings related to your PLC program.
- The Editor window, where you can write, edit, and modify your PLC program using different languages and formats. You can choose from ladder diagram, function block diagram, structured text, instruction list, sequential function chart, and others.
- The Simulator window, where you can test and debug your PLC program without connecting to a real PLC. You can run, pause, stop, and step through your program and monitor the values of variables and inputs/outputs.
- The Communication window, where you can connect to a real PLC using a USB cable or other communication methods. You can download your program to the PLC or upload it from the PLC. You can also monitor and modify the values of variables and inputs/outputs on the PLC.

The software also has several toolbars that provide quick access to various commands and functions. Some of the most common toolbars are:

- The Project toolbar, where you can add or remove files from your project, change the properties of your project, compile your project, download or upload your project to or from the PLC, and run or stop or pause or step through your project.
- The Edit toolbar, where you can insert or delete or move rows or columns in your ladder diagram or function block diagram, insert or delete or move elements in your structured text or instruction list or sequential function chart, change the format or style of your text or objects, and zoom in or out of your editor window.
- The Debug toolbar, where you can set or clear breakpoints in your program, watch the values of variables or inputs/outputs in your program, force the values of variables or inputs/outputs in your program, and trace the execution of your program.
